overview.business_description: Global glass container manufacturer supplying packaging for alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages, food, and pharmaceuticals. Products delivered through direct sales and channel partners. One of the world's largest glass container producers with operations across Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific.
business_positives: Strong customer relationships with major brands
overview.fatal_flaw: Weak operating performance - 2Q25 EBIT fell 93% YoY; elevated leverage (4.2x net); rating outlook pressures (Moody's negative, S&P stable from positive); cyclical business with volume declines
overview.recent_news: Jul 2025: 2Q25 EBIT fell 93% YoY to $7m. Feb 2025: S&P revised outlook to stable from positive on weaker performance. Nov 2024: Moody's revised outlook to negative. Oct 2024: 3Q24 EBIT turned negative at -$57m.

debt_capitalization.instrument: USD 650m Term Loan B First Lien

key_deals.deal: Sold Cristar TableTop to Nadir Figueiredo
Sold Le Parfait to Berlin Packaging for $84m
Sold Australian/New Zealand business to Visy for $513m
Acquired Nueva Fabrica Nacional de Vidrio from Grupo Modelo for $188m
Acquired Vitro's glass container business for $2.2bn

credit_opinion.summary: O-I Glass is a global leader in glass container manufacturing but facing significant operational headwinds. 2Q25 EBIT collapsed 93% YoY to just $7m. Leverage elevated at 4.2x net with Moody's outlook negative and S&P revised from positive to stable. Large TLA maturity in Mar 2027 ($2.7bn) will need refinancing. Unsecured notes yield 6.5-7.7% reflecting credit stress.
key_risks: Cyclical end markets with volume declines
credit_opinion.recommendation: UNDERWEIGHT - Operating performance severely deteriorating; avoid until EBIT stabilizes and 2027 maturity addressed
